p: The CLA, often also called Catalan-speaking or Catalan-language territories or Catalan Countries, constitute a unit that has been considered and well studied from geographic [ 49], physiographic [ 50], floristic [ 51, 52], vegetation [ 53], linguistic and cultural [ 54], and ethnoculinary and gastronomic [ 55, 56] points of view. It occupies the eastern part of the Iberian Peninsula, including a northern Pyrenean portion, the Balearic Islands and the city of l’Alguer on the island of Sardinia ( Figure 1). Politically, it is currently made up of four states, Andorra (all the territory), France (Northern Catalonia or Eastern Pyrenees department), Italy (l’Alguer), and Spain (Balearic Islands, Carxe -a small area in Murcia-, Catalonia, a portion of eastern Aragon, and Valencia). Its extension is ca. 70,000 km 2 [ 52] and it is inhabited by around 14,000,000 people [ 57].
